author: Ivey DeJesus
title: Pa. doctors report the dreaded norovirus stomach bug is going around
text:
By Ivey DeJesus ,
1 hours ago If you got together with friends or family this holiday season, you probably heard about someone who was, as the saying goes, as sick as a dog, with a violently upset stomach. The culprit: norovirus, the dreaded and contagious stomach bug that appears to be on the uptick across the northeast in the past few weeks. Read full article
Read in NewsBreak

author: Dani Gallegos
title: SCV Water Wins Fifth Consecutive US EPA WaterSense Excellence Award
text: For the fifth consecutive time since its formation in 2018, SCV Water has been recognized by the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) with a WaterSense Excellence Award. “It is a tremendous honor to win our fifth WaterSense Excellence Award in the last five years,” said [SCV Water](https://www.yourscvwater.com/) Sustainability Manager Matt Dickens. “This is a huge honor for our conservation team, the Agency, and the community as it recognizes the amazing work that all of us have done to support and enhance sustainable water use in the Santa Clarita Valley.” SCV Water was presented with a WaterSense Excellence in Education and Outreach award recognizing many of the programs and projects spearheaded by the Agency. In recognition of its commitment to promoting WaterSense and water efficiency in 2023, SCV Water was honored in a ceremony during the WaterSmart Innovations (WSI) Conference in Las Vegas on September 26, 2024, alongside more than 50 other awardees – utilities, manufacturers, builders, retailers and other organizations that partner with WaterSense to promote water-efficient products, homes and programs. “EPA is recognizing these WaterSense award winners who are helping protect our water resources while improving energy efficiency, saving customers’ money, and advancing efforts to manage climate change impacts like water scarcity and drought,” said EPA Principal Deputy Assistant Administrator for Water Bruno Pigott in a news release. For its fifth WaterSense Excellence Award, SCV Water implemented several programs and projects to assist the community and its customers with their water conservation goals. In collaboration with the City of Santa Clarita, SCV Water developed the Bridgeport Park Sustainable Landscape Demonstration Garden to promote sustainable landscapes and provide outdoor learning for local students. Further, SCV Water partnered with the University of Southern California’s Dornsife Public Exchange to study water usage awareness among residents. Findings revealed a lack of awareness and action on water conservation, prompting SCV Water to enhance engagement and remove barriers. SCV Water also continued its WaterSMART Workshop, an online e-learning module, reaching over 125 participants. Additionally, the Agency produced educational videos on fixing household leaks and promoting the Lawn Replacement Program. Ed. Note: The above information was provided to KHTS Radio by SCV Water. author: Danna Robayo Diaz
title: Estas son las vitaminas que mejoran la visión y te libran de enfermedades
text: Estas son las vitaminas que mejoran la visión y te libran de enfermedades Conoce más sobre las vitaminas que mejoran la capacidad de tu visión y en qué alimentos las puedes obtener Los problemas oculares son desafiantes en una era donde las pantallas dominan nuestro día a día. Por eso, la salud visual se ha vuelto una preocupación fundamental. Afortunadamente, la naturaleza ofrece algunas soluciones en forma de vitaminas que no solo protegen, sino que también mejoran la visión. (SIGUE CON: L [a radiación solar también es dañina para los ojos](https://www.expreso.ec/buenavida/radiacion-solar-danina-ojos-186656.html)) Una de las principales es la vitamina A. Juega un papel crucial en la formación y mantenimiento de la retina, la parte del ojo responsable de la percepción de la luz. Esta también es necesaria para la producción de rodopsina, un pigmento sensible a la luz que es vital para la visión en condiciones de poca luz, como la visión nocturna. Las fuentes naturales de obtención de vitamina A son: - Zanahorias - Espinacas - Papas - Brócoli - Hígado - Yema de huevo - Productos lácteos. Estas son las otras vitaminas buenas para los ojos - Vitamina C: Este antioxidante se encuentra en frutas cítricas como las fresas, kiwi, brócoli y pimientos. La vitamina C ayuda a mantener la salud de los vasos sanguíneos en los ojos y puede reducir el riesgo de cataratas. - Vitamina E: Presente en alimentos como nueces, semillas, aceites vegetales y espinacas. La E también actúa como antioxidante y puede proteger las células de los ojos del daño causado por los radicales libres. - Luteína y zeaxantina: Estos antioxidantes se encuentran en alimentos como espinacas, col rizada, maíz y huevos. Ayudan a filtrar la luz dañina en el ojo y pueden reducir el riesgo de desarrollar degeneración macular relacionada con la edad. - Zinc: Este mineral es importante para la salud ocular y se encuentra en alimentos como carne de res, aves de corral, nueces y granos enteros. El zinc desempeña un papel en la producción de melanina, un pigmento protector de los ojos, y también ayuda a transportar la vitamina A desde el hígado hasta la retina para producir melanina. Cosas que debes de tomar en cuenta a la hora de cuidar tus ojos Estas son algunas las recomendaciones que la médico optometrista Whitney Seltman, con estudios en Southern College of Optometry. Memphis en Estados Unidos comparte - Aliméntate bien: Para que puedas ayudar a que todas estas vitaminas y nutrientes sean correctamente absorbidas, necesitas tener una alimentación balanceada. "Una dieta bien equilibrada también ayuda a mantener un peso saludable. Eso reduce las probabilidades de obesidad y enfermedades relacionadas, como la diabetes tipo 2, que es la principal causa de ceguera en los adultos". - Dile adiós al tabaco: Los cigarrillos hacen que seas más propenso a sufrir cataratas, daños al nervio óptico y degeneración macular, entre otros problemas médicos. - Que las gafas sean tus aliadas: No solo te hacen lucir genial, sino que también protegen tus ojos de los molestos rayos UV que pueden causar estragos. Asegúrate de elegir unas que bloqueen el 100% de los rayos UVA y UVB. Las de estilo envolvente son una buena opción para mantener esos rayos fuera desde todos los ángulos - Un respiro para tus ojos: Estar pegado a la pantalla de la computadora todo el día puede ser muy complicado para tus ojos. Dales un respiro de vez en cuando. Mirar un punto determinado lejos de la pantalla cada hora puede ayudar a prevenir la fatiga ocular y reducir la tensión. Además, te da la oportunidad perfecta para estirar las piernas y tomar un breve paseo [¿Quieres acceder a todo el contenido de calidad sin límites? ¡SUSCRÍBETE AQUÍ!](https://suscripcion.expreso.ec/)

author: ( Image: Getty)
title: Zara shoppers could 'slash their bill by up to 30%' thanks to Martin Lewis tip
text:
A Zara shopper has shared a simple way you can "slash your bill" at the store, and it was actually a tip that was shared by Martin Lewis a while back. You just need to be savvy Zara shoppers could 'slash their bill by up to 30%' thanks to Martin Lewis tip
Many of us are on a mission to save pennies wherever possible, but it can be a tough task for those with a penchant for shopping.
After all, who doesn't crave a fresh outfit every now and then, especially with holiday season looming? If you're finding it hard to curb your spending, there might just be a trick to help you cut costs at Zara, provided you're patient enough.
This handy tip was initially shared by money saving guru Martin Lewis, but TikTok users have been reiterating its effectiveness in recent videos. One such video was posted by @fianancielle, who revealed an easy way to snag some budget-friendly fashion.
In her enlightening video, she explained: "If you have a summer holiday planned in Spain, Greece, Italy, France and you're still shopping at Zara, listen up. If you didn't already know, Zara is a Spanish brand, so naturally the prices of things are a lot cheaper there."
She…
( Image: Getty)

title: Real Madrid-Sporting, 3-1: leoas viram mas não agarraram - Futebol Feminino - Jornal Record
text: Já diziam os Ornatos Violeta: "Eu vi, mas não agarrei..." Este refrão do tema ‘Capitão Romance’ define na perfeição este jogo que acabou por ditar a eliminação do Sporting frente ao Real ... Técnico sueco, de 41 anos, pediu a demissão Equipa de Rita Castro e Silva soma quatro derrotas e uma vitória em 5 jogos na Liga BPI Marco Ferreira e Jorge Faustino unânimes na avaliação do lance que deu a vitória leonina e provocou reação do Benfica Leoas vencem com golo aos 89' que leva Benfica a emitir comunicado a atirar-se à arbitragem Depois de o avião ter sido desviado para um aeroporto secundário, líbios recusaram vender combustível para abastecer a aeronave Organismo quer que o regulamento esteja em conformidade com a legislação europeia Território britânico autónomo nas Caraíbas participa na Liga das Nações da Concacaf Jogador do Lorient, que foi ilibado de todas as acusações de violação no mês passado, tem dívidas de mais de 900 mil euros

author: @francophileenoz
title: Severe Thunderstorms Forecast for East Coast | Illawarra Mercury | Wollongong, NSW
text: After bouts of wild weather over Christmas, the east coast will face another round of severe thunderstorms and rain according to the Bureau of Meteorology's (BoM) latest forecast. Severe thunderstorms have eased across eastern Australia but are expected to redevelop around eastern Queensland and northeast NSW from December 30 into the New Year. Parts of Australia are set to face wet and potentially wild weather on New Years Eve and New Year's Day. BoM senior meteorologist Sarah Scully said isolated thunderstorms are possible for parts of Queensland, NSW, Victoria and South Australia. "Severe thunderstorms are possible in Queensland between St Lawrence and Redcliffe, although activity will not be as widespread compared to previous days," Ms Scully said. "Isolated gusty thunderstorms are also possible over western South Australia." Showers and storms are possible across parts of southern and eastern Australia, mainly NSW, eastern South Australia, and northern Victoria on December 29. There is a risk of severe thunderstorms in Sydney, the Blue Mountains and the Hunter regions. Severe thunderstorms will become more widespread from this weekend concentrating in north-east NSW, and south-east and central Queensland. BoM said there are indications that isolated, very dangerous thunderstorms with destructive winds, giant hail and intense rainfall may be possible across southeast Queensland on Saturday. BoM has encouraged the community to stay up to date with the latest forecasts and warnings using the BOM Weather app and website. Queensland will also experience heatwave conditions along the east coast affecting Brisbane, the Sunshine Coast and areas surrounding Cairns. Northern and Western Australia will also face heatwave conditions with temperatures reaching the mid to high 40 degree Celsius in some areas. Sign up for our newsletter to stay up to date.
